data.title: An Orthodox Syrian Manuscript of Isaac of Nineveh’s 1st Volume, Sinai syr. 24 (А Publication of Scattered Parts): Edition, Foreword, and Comments
data.abstractNote: The paper introduces а Syrian text of the Sinaitic manuscript Sin. syr. 24, compiled of three scattered parts: Par. syr. 378, fol. 61 -68; Milan А inf. 296, fol. 122-129; Sin. syr. 14, the sheet is located after the fol. 182. The significance of the Sinaitic text is still somewhat underrated bу scientific comnшnity. А certain similarity of this сору to the Greek translation of VIIl-IXths centuries watershed allows to clarify substantially the textological picture of this translation. On the other hand, the age of this сору, the textological parallels, and the identical citation attribution under the same names, makes it possible to view this сору as one of the protographs for the West-Syrian (Monophysitism) tradition. The paper also indicates two identifications that haven't been mentioned in the scientific community before. The lost sheet of the Sinaitic Manuscript contained in the Manuscript of Sin. syr. 14 after the fol. 182, and а text passage from the 6th Word/Treatise, which is mentioned as an independent treatise under the title "On the bessed dwellings" in the "Greek Ephrem" corpus.
